intro: Euonymus europaeus var. aldenhamensis, commonly known as the Aldenham euonymus, is a variant of the common euonymus, native to southern England. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves that turn reddish in autumn. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in spring, followed by orange-red蒴果 (capsules) that split open to release seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, often found in hedgerows and woodland edges. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting various insect species.
